word: The host was borne under a splendid canopy, supported by four princes of highest rank. After them walked the monarch, divested of his crown and royal robe, with uncovered head and downcast eyes, and bearing in his hand a lighted taper. Thus the king of France appeared publicly as a penitent. At every altar he bowed down in humiliation, not for the vices that defiled his soul, not the innocent blood that stained his hands, but for the deadly sin of his subjects who had dared to condemn the mass. Following him came the queen and the dignitaries of State also walking two and two, each with a lighted torch.
